headline.main: France Bounces Back to Win Show Jumping Gold; US Second
headline.print_headline: France Bounces Back to Win Show Jumping Gold; US Second

docs.snippet: France bounced back from a difficult week to claim its second team title in equestrian at the Rio Games, beating the United States to a gold medal in the show jumping Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: France bounced back from a difficult week to claim its second team title in equestrian at the Rio Games, beating the United States to a gold medal in the show jumping Wednesday.

headline.main: U.S. Assessing if Russian Use of Iran Base Violates U.N. Resolution
headline.print_headline: U.S. Assessing if Russian Use of Iran Base Violates U.N. Resolution

docs.snippet: The United States is looking at whether Russia has violated a U.N. Security Council resolution on military dealings with Tehran by using an Iranian air base to carry out strikes inside Syria, the State Department said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is looking at whether Russia has violated a U.N. Security Council resolution on military dealings with Tehran by using an Iranian air base to carry out strikes inside Syria, the State Department said on Wednesday.

headline.main: A Gift of Artworks by Women for Florida Museum

docs.snippet: Collectors are donating 100 artworks to the NSU Art Museum in Fort Lauderdale....
docs.abstract: Art collectors Francie Bishop Good and David Horvitz will donate 100 of their 800 artworks, made primarily by women and minority artists, to NSU Art Museum in Fort Lauderdale, Fla; some 70 pieces will go on view there in August in exhibition Belief & Doubt: Selections from the Francie Bishop Good and David Horvitz Collection.
docs.lead_paragraph: Collectors are donating 100 artworks to the NSU Art Museum in Fort Lauderdale.

headline.main: Neymar Scores Early, Leads Brazil to Olympic Soccer Final
headline.print_headline: Neymar Scores Early, Leads Brazil to Olympic Soccer Final

docs.snippet: With the fastest goal in Olympic history, Neymar led Brazil back to the gold-medal match....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the fastest goal in Olympic history, Neymar led Brazil back to the gold-medal match.

headline.main: Notre Dame QBs Kizer, Zaire Will Share Duties vs. Texas
headline.print_headline: Notre Dame QBs Kizer, Zaire Will Share Duties vs. Texas

docs.snippet: DeShone Kizer and Malik Zaire will share duties at quarterback when Notre Dame opens the season at Texas on Sept. 4....
docs.lead_paragraph: DeShone Kizer and Malik Zaire will share duties at quarterback when Notre Dame opens the season at Texas on Sept. 4.

headline.main: Prosecutors: Trump Tower Climber Had Planned It, Practiced
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors: Trump Tower Climber Had Planned It, Practiced

docs.snippet: A Virginia man who scaled the all-glass face of Trump Tower last week using suction cups planned his climb, ordering equipment on Amazon, practicing ahead of time and waiting until his parents were away before traveling to New York City, according...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Virginia man who scaled the all-glass face of Trump Tower last week using suction cups planned his climb, ordering equipment on Amazon, practicing ahead of time and waiting until his parents were away before traveling to New York City, according to prosecutors.

headline.main: Italian City on Swiss Border to Set Up Camp for Blocked Migrants
headline.print_headline: Italian City on Swiss Border to Set Up Camp for Blocked Migrants

docs.snippet: Italy will set up a shelter to host as many as 300 migrants stranded near the Swiss border, after Switzerland cracked down on crossings, forcing hundreds to sleep on the ground in a city park, officials said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy will set up a shelter to host as many as 300 migrants stranded near the Swiss border, after Switzerland cracked down on crossings, forcing hundreds to sleep on the ground in a city park, officials said Wednesday.

headline.main: Half the World Watching Games, Opening Ceremony Ratings Flat: IOC
headline.print_headline: Half the World Watching Games, Opening Ceremony Ratings Flat: IOC

docs.snippet: The IOC expects that, by the end of the Olympics, about half the world's population will have watched the Games, with about the same number of people watching the opening ceremony as in 2012, according to early estimates by broadcast executive Tim...
docs.lead_paragraph: The IOC expects that, by the end of the Olympics, about half the world's population will have watched the Games, with about the same number of people watching the opening ceremony as in 2012, according to early estimates by broadcast executive Timo Lumme.

headline.main: New Trump Campaign Manager to Push Candidate to Focus on Policy
headline.print_headline: New Trump Campaign Manager to Push Candidate to Focus on Policy

docs.snippet: Donald Trump's new campaign manager said on Wednesday she would encourage the Republican presidential nominee to focus on substance and continue delivering policy speeches as he has done in the last week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's new campaign manager said on Wednesday she would encourage the Republican presidential nominee to focus on substance and continue delivering policy speeches as he has done in the last week.

headline.main: Olympic Champion Andy Murray Advances in Cincinnati
headline.print_headline: Olympic Champion Andy Murray Advances in Cincinnati

docs.snippet: Andy Murray followed up his second Olympic singles title with a second-round victory Wednesday night in the Western & Southern Open....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andy Murray followed up his second Olympic singles title with a second-round victory Wednesday night in the Western & Southern Open.
